source.name: Grader
source.instructions:
To submit your deployed Heroku app, paste the URL into the file on the left (it should look something like `my-app-12345.herokuapp.com`).

Visit the same URL that you put into the text file with your web browser to be sure that your app is running correctly at that address before submitting the text file.

Submit by clicking the button below.

source.name: bundle
source.instructions: What *two* steps did we take earlier to guarantee that the Sinatra library is available to load in line 1?

answers.answer: We successfully ran bundle to confirm that the gem is installed and "lock" the correct version of it in Gemfile.lock
We downloaded the Sinatra software and installed it.
We edited the `Gemfile.lock` file to list all of the gem versions we need for our project.

source.name: unknown route
source.instructions: What happens if you try to visit a non-root URL such as https://yourcodio-boxname-9292.codio.io/hello? (your URL root will vary based on what your Codio box is named)

answers.answer: I get a humorous error message from the Sinatra framework with guidance on how I might fix this issue.
I get a 404 Not Found ( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_404 ) error.

source.guidance: You'll get a humorous error message from the Sinatra framework, since you don't have a route matching get '/hello' in your app. Since Sinatra is a SaaS framework, the error message is packaged up in a Web page and delivered to your browser. The message you see is nice and friendly and gives you advice on coding your app, for this is the development version of your web app. In the production version, the error message shows users a usual unfriendly error message (404, etc.).

source.name: MyApp URL
source.instructions: What is the URL of your myapp on Heroku?  Please copy and paste the full URL, e.g. https://hw7-myapp-msmucker.herokuapp.com/ .  We will visit this URL to check that you have properly deployed your app.
